results.title: Effect of valsartan and atenolol on sexual behavior in hypertensive postmenopausal women.
results.text_hl: In the @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, the scores for three of the items related to libido significantly improved: sexual @<m>DISEASE_Sexual_Dysfunctions_Psychological</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020018 @@@desire@@@ (+38%, P <.01), changes in behavior (+45%, P <.001), and sexual fantasies (+51%, P <.001) In contrast, in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-treated group the scores for the items "sexual @<m>DISEASE_Sexual_Dysfunctions_Psychological</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020018 @@@desire@@@" and "sexual fantasies" significantly worsened (-18%, P <.01 and -23%, P <.001, respectively).

citations.NLM: Fogari R, Preti P, Zoppi A, Corradi L, Pasotti C, Rinaldi A, Mugellini A. Effect of valsartan and atenolol on sexual behavior in hypertensive postmenopausal women. Am J Hypertens. 2004 Jan;17(1):77-81. PMID: 14700518
citations.BibTeX: @article{14700518, title={Effect of valsartan and atenolol on sexual behavior in hypertensive postmenopausal women.}, author={Fogari R and Preti P and Zoppi A and Corradi L and Pasotti C and Rinaldi A and Mugellini A}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={17}, number={1}, pages={77-81}}

results.title: Involvement of noradrenergic system within the central nucleus of the amygdala in naloxone-precipitated morphine withdrawal-induced conditioned place aversion in rats.
results.text_hl: Intra-CeA injections of beta-adrenoceptor antagonists @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (30 nmol per side) and @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@ (10 nmol per side) significantly attenuated the @CHEMICAL_Morphine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009020 @@@morphine@@@ withdrawal-induced @<m>DISEASE_Sexual_Dysfunctions_Psychological</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020018 @@@CPA@@@. Similarly, @GENE_UGT1A1 @GENE_24861 @@@beta(1)@@@-antagonist @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (30 nmol per side) or @GENE_UGT1A2 @GENE_396527 @@@beta(2)-@@@antagonist @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@butoxamine@@@ (30 nmol per side) significantly attenuated the @<m>DISEASE_Sexual_Dysfunctions_Psychological</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020018 @@@CPA@@@.

citations.NLM: Watanabe T, Nakagawa T, Yamamoto R, Maeda A, Minami M, Satoh M. Involvement of noradrenergic system within the central nucleus of the amygdala in naloxone-precipitated morphine withdrawal-induced conditioned place aversion in rats. Psychopharmacology (Berl). 2003 Oct;170(1):80-8. PMID: 12768272
citations.BibTeX: @article{12768272, title={Involvement of noradrenergic system within the central nucleus of the amygdala in naloxone-precipitated morphine withdrawal-induced conditioned place aversion in rats.}, author={Watanabe T and Nakagawa T and Yamamoto R and Maeda A and Minami M and Satoh M}, journal={Psychopharmacology (Berl)}, volume={170}, number={1}, pages={80-8}}
